When we run the program it asks us to provide two strings that are separated by a space. We can consider the first string to be the username and the second one the password.

Inside the main function there is a call to an operator named â€œmain::$_0::operator(param1, param2)â€. Itâ€™s name doesnâ€™t tell us much about its functionality but we are quickly able to tell what it is doing by looking at the code. There is a loop that iterates over all of the characters of the username and stores their sum in a separate variable. At the end of the loop the sum is returned to the main function and the result used in a comparison against the length of the password. If the sum of the characters is equal to the length of the password then we get a simple â€œyâ€ to signify that the combination was accepted.
